title: Foundations of Optical Material Design Using Deep Learning for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic physics and mathematics (functions, graphs), and basic computer literacy
context.additional_context: Learners access asynchronous learning modules via digital devices and engage in practice-centered education using simulation tools and simple neural network models.

learning_goals: The light transmission phenomenon occurring in multilayer optical materials can be explained through mathematical modeling.
A program can be designed to predict the transmittance of optical materials using deep learning-based artificial neural networks (ANN).
Material combinations to achieve given optical properties (e.g., perfect transmission) can be explored via neural network inverse design methods.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
